question: Will the number of hostages released by Hamas between January 26 and April 5, 2025 be between 10 and 19 (inclusive)?
reasoning:
Based on the evidence gathered:

1. **Hostage Releases**: As of February 26, 2025, a total of 33 hostages have been released in the first phase of the agreement, which began on January 19, 2025. The releases included 3 hostages on January 19, 4 on January 25, 3 on January 30, 3 on February 1, 3 on February 8, 3 on February 15, and 6 on February 22. This phase concluded on February 26, 2025.

2. **Post-February 26 Releases**: Between February 26 and March 25, 2025, there have been no additional releases of hostages reported. The first phase of the agreement concluded with the release of 33 hostages, and subsequent phases have not been initiated due to ongoing conflicts and ceasefire violations.

3. **Current Situation**: As of March 25, 2025, the ceasefire has ended, and hostilities have resumed. There is no indication of further hostage releases occurring between February 26 and March 25, 2025.

Given the information, it seems unlikely that the number of hostages released between January 26 and April 5, 2025, will fall between 10 and 19, as the releases have already exceeded this range by February 26, 2025, and no further releases have been reported.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.1

February 27, 2025

The release of Israeli hostages by Hamas marks a significant turning point in the ongoing conflict that erupted following Hamas' massacre of Israelis on October 7, 2023. In the brutal assault, over 1,200 people were killed, and 251 individuals were taken hostage.

As part of the first phase [hostage release agreement of January 2025](https://www.ajc.org/news/israel-hamas-hostage-deal-what-you-need-to-know), 33 of the remaining hostages are slated to be freed in stages, with the first group of three Israeli women released on January 19, 2025.

Since Hamas’ attack on October 7, [AJC has worked tirelessly alongside more than 50 hostage families](https://www.ajc.org/advocating-for-the-hostages), advocating globally to keep their stories front and center with officials, including over 200 members of Congress, diplomats, and faith leaders.

Here is what to know about the hostage release schedule.

*This explainer will continue to be updated as more information is released. AJC also breaks down what you need to know about the **Palestinian Prisoners Freed in the Hostage Agreement** and **What The Hostages Endured in Captivity*

**When are the hostage releases happening? **

The first phase covers a span of six weeks and includes the release of 33 hostages, including 12 women and children, men aged 50 and above, and injured civilians, including two Americans.

Three hostages were released on the first day, and four more released on the seventh day. After that, three hostages will be released every seven days, and the final 14 will be released in the final week of the first phase.

description: Analysis in English on occupied Palestinian territory about Food and Nutrition, Health and more; published on 25 Mar 2025 by ACAPS
sitename: ReliefWeb
date: 2025-03-25

On the evening of 17 March 2025, Israel unilaterally ended the ceasefire that it agreed upon with Hamas on 15 January, launching air strikes on Gaza as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced the resumption of conflict. Even during the ceasefire period, Israel also continued its attacks and has imposed blockade on Gaza since March 2, albeit at a lower scale. Between 19 January and 17 March, during the ceasefire, Israel had killed at least 170 Gazans and allowed only 70% of the 600 aid trucks to be allowed in daily (AJ 18/03/2025 a). The 17 March air strikes killed at least 404 civilians (170 children and 80 women) and injured around 660. On 20 March, Israel launched additional air strikes and resumed ground operations, killing around 91 Palestinians and wounding dozens (Reuters 20/03/2025 and 18/03/2025; OCHA 18/03/2025 a; The Guardian 18/03/2025). On Monday 24 March, Israel launched several strikes killing at least 65 civilians, including children and journalists, the attacks have been registered in Khan Younis, southern Gaza, Beit Lahiya and attacks to the Red Cross building in Rafah (The Guardian 24/03/2025; France24 24/03/2025).

Until 25 March, many bodies had not been retrieved from under rubble. The death toll continues to rise as injured individuals fail to receive access to essential medicine because of Israel’s most recent and longest blockade on Gaza since 2 March. Medical facilities are also overwhelmed, with many destroyed, rendering them unable to provide adequate treatment (OCHA 18/03/2025 a; The Guardian 18/03/2025). With the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) specifically targeting hospitals and healthcare workers since October 2023, causing Gaza’s health system to collapse completely, leaving it without any capacity even before the ceasefire (Insecurity Insight 06/11/2024).

Until 25 March 2025, no safe zones had been established. At the same time, the IDF also attacked previously designated safe areas before the ceasefire, and the recent air strikes hit Al Mawa…

# Hamas says it will only release American-Israeli hostage if ceasefire deal is implemented

## Hamas says it will only release American-Israeli hostage if ceasefire deal is implemented

CAIRO (AP) — Hamas said Saturday it will only release an American-Israeli and the bodies of four other hostages if Israel implements their [ceasefire agreement](https://apnews.com/hub/israel-hamas-war), calling it an “exceptional deal” aimed at getting the truce back on track.

Israeli airstrikes meanwhile killed nine people in the Gaza Strip who the military identified as militants, allegations denied by a U.K.-based aid group that said eight of its workers were killed.

A senior Hamas official said long-delayed talks over [the ceasefire’s second phase](https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-hamas-war-ceasefire-hostages-witkoff-plan-46a639d66772915ba1ed0b43cd2728d8) would need to begin the day of the release and last no longer than 50 days. Israel also would need to stop [barring the entry of humanitarian aid](https://apnews.com/article/gaza-israel-hamas-palestinians-aid-explainer-ecc0e70d5ff1120a04bf36626dfd96f4) and withdraw from [a strategic corridor](https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-hamas-war-ceasefire-egypt-gaza-corridor-ca9615f42004a47bafe969fef1377e04) along Gaza’s border with Egypt. title: Who Are the Israeli Hostages Being Released? Full Schedule and Latest Updates
url: https://www.ajc.org/news/who-are-the-israeli-hostages-being-released-full-schedule-and-latest-updates
hostname: ajc.org
description: When will the next hostages be released? Discover the details of the Israel-Hamas hostage and ceasefire deal, including the release of 33 hostages and ongoing negotiations for remaining captives. Learn about the phases of the agreement, the American hostages held by Hamas, and how families have endured months of advocacy and uncertainty. Stay updated on this pivotal development in the Israel-Gaza conflict
sitename: AJC
date: 2025-01-30
tags: ['Israel', 'History and Context: Israel-Hamas War', 'Update on Hamas-Israel War']
---
February 27, 2025

The release of Israeli hostages by Hamas marks a significant turning point in the ongoing conflict that erupted following Hamas' massacre of Israelis on October 7, 2023. In the brutal assault, over 1,200 people were killed, and 251 individuals were taken hostage.

As part of the first phase [hostage release agreement of January 2025](https://www.ajc.org/news/israel-hamas-hostage-deal-what-you-need-to-know), 33 of the remaining hostages are slated to be freed in stages, with the first group of three Israeli women released on January 19, 2025.

Since Hamas’ attack on October 7, [AJC has worked tirelessly alongside more than 50 hostage families](https://www.ajc.org/advocating-for-the-hostages), advocating globally to keep their stories front and center with officials, including over 200 members of Congress, diplomats, and faith leaders.

Here is what to know about the hostage release schedule.

*This explainer will continue to be updated as more information is released. AJC also breaks down what you need to know about the **Palestinian Prisoners Freed in the Hostage Agreement** and **What The Hostages Endured in Captivity*

**When are the hostage releases happening? **

The first phase covers a span of six weeks and includes the release of 33 hostages, including 12 women and children, men aged 50 and above, and injured civilians, including two Americans.

Three hostages were released on the first day, and four more released on the seventh day. After that, three hostages will be released every seven days, and the final 14 will be released in the final week of the first phase.

It is important to note that Hamas, a designated terror organization by multiple countries, is known for its use of psycho…

content.snippet:
---
title: ACAPS Briefing note: Palestine - End of ceasefire and blockade in Gaza (25 March 2025) - occupied Palestinian territory
url: https://reliefweb.int/report/occupied-palestinian-territory/acaps-briefing-note-palestine-end-ceasefire-and-blockade-gaza-25-march-2025
hostname: reliefweb.int
description: Analysis in English on occupied Palestinian territory about Food and Nutrition, Health and more; published on 25 Mar 2025 by ACAPS
sitename: ReliefWeb
date: 2025-03-25
---
On the evening of 17 March 2025, Israel unilaterally ended the ceasefire that it agreed upon with Hamas on 15 January, launching air strikes on Gaza as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced the resumption of conflict. Even during the ceasefire period, Israel also continued its attacks and has imposed blockade on Gaza since March 2, albeit at a lower scale. Between 19 January and 17 March, during the ceasefire, Israel had killed at least 170 Gazans and allowed only 70% of the 600 aid trucks to be allowed in daily (AJ 18/03/2025 a). The 17 March air strikes killed at least 404 civilians (170 children and 80 women) and injured around 660. On 20 March, Israel launched additional air strikes and resumed ground operations, killing around 91 Palestinians and wounding dozens (Reuters 20/03/2025 and 18/03/2025; OCHA 18/03/2025 a; The Guardian 18/03/2025). On Monday 24 March, Israel launched several strikes killing at least 65 civilians, including children and journalists, the attacks have been registered in Khan Younis, southern Gaza, Beit Lahiya and attacks to the Red Cross building in Rafah (The Guardian 24/03/2025; France24 24/03/2025).

Until 25 March, many bodies had not been retrieved from under rubble. The death toll continues to rise as injured individuals fail to receive access to essential medicine because of Israel’s most recent and longest blockade on Gaza since 2 March. Medical facilities are also overwhelmed, with many destroyed, rendering them unable to provide adequate treatment (OCHA 18/03/2025 a; The Guardian 18/03/2025). With the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) specifically targeting hospitals and healthcare workers since October 2023, causing Gaza’s health system to collapse completely, leaving it without any capacity even before the ceasefire (Insecurity Insight 06/11/2024).

Until 25 March 2025, no safe zones had been established. At the same time, the IDF also attacked previously designated safe areas before the ceasefire, and the recent air strikes hit Al Mawa…

# Hamas says it will only release American-Israeli hostage if ceasefire deal is implemented

## Hamas says it will only release American-Israeli hostage if ceasefire deal is implemented

CAIRO (AP) — Hamas said Saturday it will only release an American-Israeli and the bodies of four other hostages if Israel implements their [ceasefire agreement](https://apnews.com/hub/israel-hamas-war), calling it an “exceptional deal” aimed at getting the truce back on track.

Israeli airstrikes meanwhile killed nine people in the Gaza Strip who the military identified as militants, allegations denied by a U.K.-based aid group that said eight of its workers were killed.

A senior Hamas official said long-delayed talks over [the ceasefire’s second phase](https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-hamas-war-ceasefire-hostages-witkoff-plan-46a639d66772915ba1ed0b43cd2728d8) would need to begin the day of the release and last no longer than 50 days. Israel also would need to stop [barring the entry of humanitarian aid](https://apnews.com/article/gaza-israel-hamas-palestinians-aid-explainer-ecc0e70d5ff1120a04bf36626dfd96f4) and withdraw from [a strategic corridor](https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-hamas-war-ceasefire-egypt-gaza-corridor-ca9615f42004a47bafe969fef1377e04) along Gaza’s border with Egypt. [Israel has said](https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-hamas-war-news-02-27-2025-cfcdd8786afe4bc73ae79b3e0e4ccb3b) it won’t pull out from t…

Based on the following question, analyze it carefully and provide your probability estimate.

Question: Will the number of hostages released by Hamas between January 26 and April 5, 2025 be between 10 and 19 (inclusive)?
Background: As of January 23, 2025, Israel and Hamas [are observing a ceasefire](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/cx25g41d8r8o) that began on January 19, 2025, following 15 months of intense conflict. Despite the ceasefire, tensions persist. Israeli forces [have conducted](https://apnews.com/article/israel-hamas-war-syria-lebanon-news-01-23-2025-44893a87c081bf5e59ee8fe66975f250) operations in the West Bank, resulting in casualties among Palestinian militants. Hamas [has reasserted](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/hamas-tight-grip-gaza-complicates-plan-for-lasting-peace-2025-01-22/) control over Gaza, complicating efforts for lasting peace. While the ceasefire has halted large-scale hostilities, the situation remains fragile, with [both sides expressing skepticism](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/jan/19/gaza-ceasefire-will-israel-hamas-agreement-hold) about the truce's durability. Hamas has released 3 Israeli hostages and [is planning](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-hostages-get-heartfelt-tribute-tel-aviv-drag-festival-2025-01-23/) to release some 30 more.
Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as 'YES' if the total number of hostages released by Hamas after January 26, 2025 and before April 5, 2025 is between 10 and 19 (inclusive), according to credible sources. Otherwise, it will resolve as 'NO'.
Fine print: 
present_date: 2025-03-25T19:02:59.957346


Make sure to use the tools at your disposal to gather relevant information before providing your final probability estimate.

You may reason through the problem, but you MUST end your response with:
FINAL PROBABILITY: [your decimal number between 0 and 1]

{"url": "https://www.ajc.org/news/who-are-the-israeli-hostages-being-released-full-schedule-and-latest-updates", "snippet": "---
title: Who Are the Israeli Hostages Being Released? Full Schedule and Latest Updates
url: https://www.ajc.org/news/who-are-the-israeli-hostages-being-released-full-schedule-and-latest-updates
hostname: ajc.org
description: When will the next hostages be released? Discover the details of the Israel-Hamas hostage and ceasefire deal, including the release of 33 hostages and ongoing negotiations for remaining captives. Learn about the phases of the agreement, the American hostages held by Hamas, and how families have endured months of advocacy and uncertainty. Stay updated on this pivotal development in the Israel-Gaza conflict
sitename: AJC
date: 2025-01-30
tags: ['Israel', 'History and Context: Israel-Hamas War', 'Update on Hamas-Israel War']
---
February 27, 2025

The release of Israeli hostages by Hamas marks a significant turning point in the ongoing conflict that erupted following Hamas' massacre of Israelis on October 7, 2023. In the brutal assault, over 1,200 people were killed, and 251 individuals were taken hostage.

As part of the first phase [hostage release agreement of January 2025](https://www.ajc.org/news/israel-hamas-hostage-deal-what-you-need-to-know), 33 of the remaining hostages are slated to be freed in stages, with the first group of three Israeli women released on January 19, 2025.

Since Hamas’ attack on October 7, [AJC has worked tirelessly alongside more than 50 hostage families](https://www.ajc.org/advocating-for-the-hostages), advocating globally to keep their stories front and center with officials, including over 200 members of Congress, diplomats, and faith leaders.

Here is what to know about the hostage release schedule.

*This explainer will continue to be updated as more information is released. AJC also breaks down what you need to know about the **Palestinian Prisoners Freed in the Hostage Agreement** and **What The Hostages Endured in Captivity*

**When are the hostage releases happening? **

The first phase covers a span of six weeks and includes the release of 33 hostages, including 12 women and children, men aged 50 and above, and injured civilians, including two Americans.

Three hostages were released on the first day, and four more released on the seventh day. After that, three hostages will be released every seven days, and the final 14 will be released in the final week of the first phase.

It is important to note that Hamas, a designated terror organization by multiple countries, is known for its use of psycho…

title: ACAPS Briefing note: Palestine - End of ceasefire and blockade in Gaza (25 March 2025) - occupied Palestinian territory
url: https://reliefweb.int/report/occupied-palestinian-territory/acaps-briefing-note-palestine-end-ceasefire-and-blockade-gaza-25-march-2025
hostname: reliefweb.int
description: Analysis in English on occupied Palestinian territory about Food and Nutrition, Health and more; published on 25 Mar 2025 by ACAPS
sitename: ReliefWeb
date: 2025-03-25
---
On the evening of 17 March 2025, Israel unilaterally ended the ceasefire that it agreed upon with Hamas on 15 January, launching air strikes on Gaza as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced the resumption of conflict. Even during the ceasefire period, Israel also continued its attacks and has imposed blockade on Gaza since March 2, albeit at a lower scale. Between 19 January and 17 March, during the ceasefire, Israel had killed at least 170 Gazans and allowed only 70% of the 600 aid trucks to be allowed in daily (AJ 18/03/2025 a). The 17 March air strikes killed at least 404 civilians (170 children and 80 women) and injured around 660. On 20 March, Israel launched additional air strikes and resumed ground operations, killing around 91 Palestinians and wounding dozens (Reuters 20/03/2025 and 18/03/2025; OCHA 18/03/2025 a; The Guardian 18/03/2025). On Monday 24 March, Israel launched several strikes killing at least 65 civilians, including children and journalists, the attacks have been registered in Khan Younis, southern Gaza, Beit Lahiya and attacks to the Red Cross building in Rafah (The Guardian 24/03/2025; France24 24/03/2025).

Until 25 March, many bodies had not been retrieved from under rubble. The death toll continues to rise as injured individuals fail to receive access to essential medicine because of Israel’s most recent and longest blockade on Gaza since 2 March. Medical facilities are also overwhelmed, with many destroyed, rendering them unable to provide adequate treatment (OCHA 18/03/2025 a; The Guardian 18/03/2025). With the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) specifically targeting hospitals and healthcare workers since October 2023, causing Gaza’s health system to collapse completely, leaving it without any capacity even before the ceasefire (Insecurity Insight 06/11/2024).

Until 25 March 2025, no safe zones had been established. At the same time, the IDF also attacked previously designated safe areas before the ceasefire, and the recent air strikes hit Al Mawa…

# Hamas says it will only release American-Israeli hostage if ceasefire deal is implemented

## Hamas says it will only release American-Israeli hostage if ceasefire deal is implemented

CAIRO (AP) — Hamas said Saturday it will only release an American-Israeli and the bodies of four other hostages if Israel implements their [ceasefire agreement](https://apnews.com/hub/israel-hamas-war), calling it an “exceptional deal” aimed at getting the truce back on track.

Israeli airstrikes meanwhile killed nine people in the Gaza Strip who the military identified as militants, allegations denied by a U.K.-based aid group that said eight of its workers were killed.

A senior Hamas official said long-delayed talks over [the ceasefire’s second phase](https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-hamas-war-ceasefire-hostages-witkoff-plan-46a639d66772915ba1ed0b43cd2728d8) would need to begin the day of the release and last no longer than 50 days. Israel also would need to stop [barring the entry of humanitarian aid](https://apnews.com/article/gaza-israel-hamas-palestinians-aid-explainer-ecc0e70d5ff1120a04bf36626dfd96f4) and withdraw from [a strategic corridor](https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-hamas-war-ceasefire-egypt-gaza-corridor-ca9615f42004a47bafe969fef1377e04) along Gaza’s border with Egypt. [Israel has said](https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-hamas-war-news-02-27-2025-cfcdd8786afe4bc73ae79b3e0e4ccb3b) it won’t pull out from t…

messages.content:
Based on the evidence gathered:

1. **Hostage Releases**: As of February 26, 2025, a total of 33 hostages have been released in the first phase of the agreement, which began on January 19, 2025. The releases included 3 hostages on January 19, 4 on January 25, 3 on January 30, 3 on February 1, 3 on February 8, 3 on February 15, and 6 on February 22. This phase concluded on February 26, 2025.

2. **Post-February 26 Releases**: Between February 26 and March 25, 2025, there have been no additional releases of hostages reported. The first phase of the agreement concluded with the release of 33 hostages, and subsequent phases have not been initiated due to ongoing conflicts and ceasefire violations.

3. **Current Situation**: As of March 25, 2025, the ceasefire has ended, and hostilities have resumed. There is no indication of further hostage releases occurring between February 26 and March 25, 2025.

Given the information, it seems unlikely that the number of hostages released between January 26 and April 5, 2025, will fall between 10 and 19, as the releases have already exceeded this range by February 26, 2025, and no further releases have been reported.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.1
